com.intel.icecp.core.modules

Interface Modules


  • public interface Modules

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ModuleInstance get(long id)
      Retrieve a module from the list of loaded modules.
      Collection<ModuleInstance> getAll() 
      CompletableFuture<Collection<Long>> load(Channel<BytesMessage> moduleChannel, String moduleNameRegex, Channel<ConfigurationMessage> configurationChannel)
      Retrieve an (assumed) JAR file and load only the modules matching the regular expression passed as moduleNameRegex.
      CompletableFuture<Long> start(long id)
      Start the module in the execution pool; any thread with access to the ModulePermission("module-name") can start and stop the module.
      CompletableFuture<Void> stop(long id, Module.StopReason reason)
      Stop the module (assumes the module implements the stop() contract correctly).
      CompletableFuture<Void> stopAll(Module.StopReason reason)
      Stop all modules

    • Method Detail

      • get

        ModuleInstance get(long id)
            throws ModuleNotFoundException
        Retrieve a module from the list of loaded modules. Access is checked with ModulePermission("module-name").
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the module instance to retrieve
        Returns:
        the Module instance
        Throws:
        ModuleNotFoundException - if the module has not yet been loaded

      • getAll

        Collection<ModuleInstance> getAll()
        Returns:
        all module instances currently loaded on the system

      • load

        CompletableFuture<Collection<Long>> load(Channel<BytesMessage> moduleChannel,
                                         String moduleNameRegex,
                                         Channel<ConfigurationMessage> configurationChannel)
        Retrieve an (assumed) JAR file and load only the modules matching the regular expression passed as moduleNameRegex.

        If module implementors need to run multiple instances of their module, call this method multiple times.

        Parameters:
        moduleChannel - a document channel returning the bytes of a JAR file
        moduleNameRegex - a unique name identifying the module inside the JAR, matches the name specified on the module with ModuleProperty
        configurationChannel - a channel for retrieving configuration to load with the module
        Returns:
        a future that resolves to a collection of all loaded module IDs

      • start

        CompletableFuture<Long> start(long id)
        Start the module in the execution pool; any thread with access to the ModulePermission("module-name") can start and stop the module.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the module instance to start
        Returns:
        a future that completes once the module is started, the result will contain the passed ID

      • stop

        CompletableFuture<Void> stop(long id,
                             Module.StopReason reason)
        Stop the module (assumes the module implements the stop() contract correctly). Any thread with access to the ModulePermission("module-name") can start and stop the module. TODO is there a way to force this? Tried with Future.cancel() but this only works if the module respects InterruptedExceptions (and sleeps).
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the module instance to start
        reason - a Module.StopReason describing why to stop the module
        Returns:
        a future that completes once the module is stopped

      • stopAll

        CompletableFuture<Void> stopAll(Module.StopReason reason)
        Stop all modules
        Parameters:
        reason - a Module.StopReason describing why to stop the modules
        Returns:
        a future that completes once all modules are stopped
